section.title: Past obligation / permission
section.sectiontitle: To talk about obligation in the past, use had to + verb.
section.text1a: We had to learn how to sing to an audience.
section.text2a: We didn't have to wear suits.
section.sectiontitle2: To talk about permission in the past, use: allowed + person (active form) or be allowed to + verb (passive form)
section.text3a: They allowed me to use their phone.
section.text4a: I was allowed to watch TV late at night.

section.title: Past obligation
section.sectiontitle: To talk about permission in the past we can also use could + verb.
section.text1a: We could go to bed when we wanted.
section.text2a: We couldn't smoke in the house.
